Articles.Content:
Coming back to KSP much like Haley's comet.   Every few months I circle back to it.

I've done a bit of looking and can't find the answer.

Does Career mode offer contracts that utilize the new Breaking Ground content, or is the new expansion more of a "go out and mess around with it" type?
Or is it more useful in Science mode?

Thanks.

 

Edited October 12, 2019 by EmanonP
added info

@EmanonP

I believe there are contracts to set up surface experiment stations, but don’t quote me on that. I only very rarely play career or science mode.

There are contract for "go out and use a scanner arm" and "go and do some deployed science".

I have not seen any contract that requires the use of the robotic parts.
The Surface Features and Deployed Science have contracts. There are no contracts for Robotics.

The one type of contract that Breaking Ground is sorely missing is contracts that require prop plane engine planes and/or helicopters. 

 

The new prop parts allowing for helicopters and prop planes are wonderful, now just need some contracts to encourage practical use instead of "just because" reasons.

On 10/27/2019 at 1:23 PM, JPLRepo said:

The Surface Features and Deployed Science have contracts. There are no contracts for Robotics.

   

Sigh. That's really a missed opportunity. Such contracts might actually have gotten me to play Career again.
